wikipedia_page.main: Kieran Tierney (born 5 June 1997) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a left-back or centre-back for Premier League club Arsenal and the Scotland national team.Tierney came through the Celtic youth system and made his first team debut in April 2015, and his full international debut in March 2016. He joined Arsenal in August 2019 for a fee reported at £25 million, a record amount both for a Scottish national and for a player from the Scottish league.

response: * Most expensive export from Scottish football: Kieran Tierney to Arsenal (August 2019).

Our Lady's High School is a Roman Catholic secondary located in Dalzell Drive, near Fir Park Stadium. At one point it was the largest school in Western Europe, but the current school roll is around 700. Notable alumni of Our Lady's include Manchester City footballer and Manchester United manager Sir Matt Busby, Celtic F.C. footballer Billy McNeill, footballer Stephen Pearson Derby County footballer Kieran Tierney Celtic F.C. and footballer Chris Cadden Motherwell F.C.
* Kieran Tierney (born 1997 in Douglas) a Manx-born, Scottish international footballer. He plays for Arsenal F.C.
*Kieran Tierney, footballer for Arsenal and the Scotland national team
* Kieran Tierney Scottish (born 1997), professional footballer for Celtic Football Club Glasgow, Arsenal F.C London,Scottish national team.

link_mentions.page: PFA Scotland Young Player of the Year
response: As of 2021, the award has been presented 43 times and won by 38 different players. Kieran Tierney (3), Craig Levein (2), Eoin Jess (2) and Phil O'Donnell (2) are the players who have won the award more than once.
